intro: Pelargonium incisum, commonly known as the serrated geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its serrated leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Pelargonium incisum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
